greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients of (1 - x)^n*U(n,-(3*x - 2)/(2*x - 2)), where U(n,x) is the n-th Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind.
comment: The n-th row consists of the coefficients in the expansion of Sum_{j=0..n} A053122(n,j)*x^j*(1 - x)^(n - j).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Chebyshev Polynomial of the Second Kind
formula: Row n = coefficients in the expansion of (1/sqrt((5*x - 4)*x))*(((3*x - 2 + sqrt((5*x - 4)*x))/2)^(n + 1) - ((3*x - 2 - sqrt((5*x - 4)*x))/2)^(n + 1)).
example: ... reformatted and extended. _Franck Maminirina Ramaharo_, Oct 10 2018
mathematica: c0 = Table[CoefficientList[Sum[b0[[m + 1]][[n + 1]]*x^n*(1 - x)^(m - n), {n, 0, m}], x], {m, 0, 10}]; Flatten[c0]
b = Table[CoefficientList[Sum[a[[m + 1]][[n + 1]]*x^n*(1 - x)^(m - n), {n, 0, m}], x], {m, 0, 10}]; Flatten[b]
program: A053122(n, k) := if n < k then 0 else ((-1)^(n - k))*binomial(n + k + 1,  2*k + 1)$
T(n, k) := ratcoef(P(x, n), x, k)$
tabl(nn) := for n:0 thru nn do print(makelist(T(n, k), k, 0, hipow(P(x, n), x)))$ /* _Franck Maminirina Ramaharo_, Oct 10 2018 */
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 24 2006
ext: Edited, new name, and offset corrected by _Franck Maminirina Ramaharo_, Oct 10 2018
